alert.note: Alert for Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lakeshore Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 3:59AM EDT until August 17 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...LAKESHORE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Lakeshore Flood Advisory, minor lakeshore flooding. For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous swimming conditions are expected due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Southern Schoolcraft County. * WHEN...For the Lakeshore Flood Advisory, until noon EDT today. For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 8 AM EDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property along the lakeshore. High wave action and dangerous currents will lead to life threatening swimming conditions. Waves in rapid succession can tire swimmers quickly. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Current related fatalities and rescues in the past have occurred due to similar wave conditions at locations listed below: For Southern Schoolcraft County: Near Lakeview Park and Seul Choix Point.
info.instruction: Residents on or near the shore should take appropriate action to protect property from rising water levels. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
